A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Question: Can a Star Wars Movie be made that is worse than the prequels? The answer is Yes. And that movie is Star Wars: the Last Jedi. This movie seemed to be more interested in cheap gags\, visuals\, cliched dialog\, character Cameos\, and a few too many attempts a forced sentimentality. What was a two and half hour movie seemed to drag on for much longer than that as an incoherent story seemed to drag along trying to find a plot and a decent way to end. Speaking of ending\, I asked myself at least twice\, when the movie seemed to reach a conclusion\, yet continued on\, “When is this movie going to end?” Even my youngest son asked after the movie was over\, “That was a long movie\, how long were we in there\, four hours?” His brother told him\, “No\, only 2 hours and 22 minutes.” Only a true blue Star Wars Nerd might enjoy this one. What a disappointment!
